title: First Contact
description: Preternatural? With all the benefits of our science and history we earthlings still seem to find it impossible to communicate effectively. It is a rare moment in time that peace extends around our little planet. What is to be expected then when our people make contact with creatures or intelligences from other worlds? Perhaps the answers to our problems of the past, present and future are to be found in the fertile imaginings of such renowned writers as these:Introduction (First Contact) • essay by Damon Knight First Contact • (1945) • novelette by Murray Leinster Doomsday Deferred • (1949) • shortstory by Murray Leinster [as by Will F.
